page.title: 01GOREBRIDGE
page.content: GOREBRIDGE THE VILLAGE WAS FORMERLY A MINING COMMUNITY WHICH DEPENDED ON 2 LOCAL PITS,THE GORE AND THE EMILY,UNTIL THEY WERE CLOSED IN 1962,FOLLOWED BY THE RAILWAY IN 1969.A FREQUENT BUS SERVICE NOW SERVES THE VILLAGE ALLOWING THE RESIDENTS TO TRAVEL TO DALKEITH & EDINBURGH WHERE THEY CAN SHOP IN LARGE STORES. THE BINGS HAVE BEEN MADE INTO AN ATTRACTIVE OPEN SPACE AND PICNIC AREA.A NEW LEISURE CENTRE OPENED IN 1980 AND THERE ARE PLANS FOR A BIG HOUSING DEVELOPMENT AS OLD INDUSTRIAL WORKS ARE DEMOLISHED.CEREAL,DAIRY AND BEEF FARMING IS THE MAIN AGRICULTURAL PURSUIT.A WEEKLY OPEN AIR MARKET IS HELD IN THE TOWN.AT A RECENT CENSUS THE POPULATION WAS JUST UNDER 6000 AND IT ALSO SHOWED AN INCREASE OF BIRTHS OVER DEATHS OVER THE LAST 4 YEARS.
